page.title: 16 Forestry
page.content: In terms of forest Britain is one of the poorest countries in Europe with only about 9% of these islands under woodland. The wood that we are growing is of such a low standard that it is only being used for paper pulp and non-structual woodwork.Unless there is a change of direction it seems that by 2020 hardwood timber will be one of the rarest resources on earth.British foresters are proud of there achievments over the years but they have not been without criticism. Since Yardley Chase has been managed by the Forestry Commision, much of it has been replanted with the faster growing varieties of trees such as the Spruce and the Pine, now however that policy is changing aand Oaks are once again being planted in The Chase. At one time the forest provided the village with a thriving industry.
